page.title: 01The Main Features.
page.content: Craven Arms is a small market town in South Shropshire.The town occupies a fairly level site at about 450 ft. with the River Onny flowing from N.to S.along the eastern side of the town, separating it from the small village of Halford on its east bank.Halford is the older settlement and Craven Arms has grown up around the road junction where the N. to S. A49(T) is crossed by the E. to W. B4368.These roads and the A.489 follow natural routeways from their meeting point at Craven Arms.The railway line runs parallel to the A49 and has contributed to the growth and development of the town.The area has a strong agricultural influence and Craven Arms is an important centre to the local farming community.The town has a small, newly developed industrial estate.
